00046 ## @brief The TreeParser class parses the arch (XML) of tree views.
00047 #
00048 # In order to use this function execute the parse() function with the XML
00049 # data to parse as string.
00050 # This will fill in the title (string), toolbar (boolean) and fieldsOrder 
00051 # (list). 
00052 #
00053 # title contains the 'string' attribute set in the 'tree'
00054 # tag of the XML or 'Tree' if none was specified. The 
00055 # same applies to the toolbar property with the 'toolbar' attribute.
00056 # The fieldsOrder property, is the list of field names specified in the XML
00057 # in the exact same order that appear there.
00058 class TreeParser:
00059         def tagStart(self, name, attrs):
00060                 if name=='tree':
00061                         self.title = attrs.get('string',_('Tree'))
00062                         self.toolbar = bool(attrs.get('toolbar',False))
00063                 elif name=='field':
00064                         if 'icon' in attrs:
00065                                 self.fieldsOrder.append(str(attrs['icon']))
00066                         self.fieldsOrder.append(str(attrs['name']))
00067                 else:
00068                         import logging
00069                         log = logging.getLogger('view')
00070                         log.error('unknown tag: '+str(name))
00071                         del log
00072 
00073         ## @brief This function parses the xml data provided as parameter.
00074         # This function fills class member properties: title, toolbar and 
00075         # fieldsOrder
00076         def parse(self, xmlData):
00077                 self.fieldsOrder = []
00078 
00079                 psr = expat.ParserCreate()
00080                 psr.StartElementHandler = self.tagStart
00081                 psr.Parse(xmlData.encode('utf-8'))
00082 
00083 (TreeWidgetUi, TreeWidgetBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('tree.ui') )
00084 
00085 ## @brief The TreeWidget class shows main menu tree as well as other tree views.
00086 class TreeWidget( QWidget, TreeWidgetUi ): 
00087         def __init__( self, view, model, domain=[], context={}, name=False, parent=None ):
00088                 QWidget.__init__(self,parent)
00089                 TreeWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00090                 self.setupUi( self )
00091                 
00092                 self.uiSplitter.setStretchFactor( 0, 0 )
00093                 self.uiSplitter.setStretchFactor( 1, 2 )
00094 
00095                 self.context=context
00096                 self.model = view['model']
00097                 if view.get('field_parent', False):
00098                         self.domain = []
00099                 else:
00100                         self.domain = domain
00101                 self.view = view
00102 
00103                 # Next expression sounds absurd but field_parent contains the
00104                 # name of the field that links to the children: 'child_id' for
00105                 # the ir.ui.menu for example
00106                 self.childrenField = self.view['field_parent']
00107 
00108                 self.handlers = {
00109                         'Switch': self.editCurrentItem,
00110                         'Print': self.printCurrent,
00111                         'PrintHtml': self.printHtmlCurrent,
00112                         'Reload': self.reload,
00113                 }
00114 
00115                 p = TreeParser()
00116                 p.parse( view['arch'] )
00117                 self.toolbar = p.toolbar
00118 
00119                 # Get all visible fields + parent field description
00120                 self.fields = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.model, 'fields_get', p.fieldsOrder + [self.childrenField], self.context)
00121 
00122                 self.treeModel = KooModel( self )
00123                 self.treeModel.setFields( self.fields )
00124                 self.treeModel.setFieldsOrder( p.fieldsOrder )
00125                 self.treeModel.setIconForField( 'icon', 'name')
00126                 self.treeModel.setChildrenForField( self.childrenField, p.fieldsOrder[0] )
00127                 self.treeModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00128 
00129                 self.listModel = KooModel( self )
00130                 self.listModel.setMode( KooModel.ListMode )
00131                 self.listModel.setFields( self.fields )
00132                 if 'name' in p.fieldsOrder:
00133                         self.listModel.setFieldsOrder( ['name'] )
00134                 else:
00135                         self.listModel.setFieldsOrder( p.fieldsOrder )
00136                 self.listModel.setIconForField( 'icon', 'name' )
00137                 self.listModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00138 
00139                 self.group = RecordGroup( self.model, self.fields, context = self.context )
00140                 self.group.setDomain( domain )
00141                 if self.toolbar:
00142                         self.listModel.setRecordGroup( self.group )
00143                 else:
00144                         self.treeModel.setRecordGroup( self.group )
00145 
00146                 self.uiTree.setModel( self.treeModel )
00147                 self.uiList.setModel( self.listModel )
00148 
00149                 self.connect(self.uiTree,SIGNAL('activated( QModelIndex ) ' ), self.open )
00150 
00151                 self.treeAllExpandedState = {}
00152                 self.treeState = {}
00153                 if self.toolbar:
00154                         # Save index states if we're showing uiList widget only, otherwise we don't need it.
00155                         self.connect(self.uiTree,SIGNAL('expanded( QModelIndex )'), self.saveIndexState )
00156                         self.connect(self.uiTree,SIGNAL('collapsed( QModelIndex )'), self.saveIndexState )
00157 
00158                 self.connect(self.pushShortcuts, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.editShortcuts)
00159                 self.connect(self.pushAddShortcut, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.addShortcut)
00160                 self.connect(self.pushRemoveShortcut, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.removeShortcut)
00161                 self.connect(self.pushExpand, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.expand)
00162                 self.connect(self.uiShortcuts, SIGNAL('activated(QModelIndex)'), self.goToShortcut)
00163                 self.connect(self.uiList.selectionModel(),SIGNAL('currentChanged(QModelIndex, QModelIndex)'),self.mainMenuClicked)
00164 
00165                 if name:
00166                         self.name = name
00167                 else:
00168                         self.name = p.title
00169                 
00170                 # Shortcuts
00171                 scFields = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'fields_get', ['res_id', 'name'])
00172                 self.shortcutsGroup = RecordGroup( 'ir.ui.view_sc', scFields, context = self.context )
00173                 self.shortcutsGroup.setDomain( [('user_id','=',Rpc.session.uid), ('resource','=',model)] )
00174 
00175                 self.shortcutsModel = KooModel( self )
00176                 self.shortcutsModel.setMode( KooModel.ListMode )
00177                 self.shortcutsModel.setFields( scFields )
00178                 self.shortcutsModel.setFieldsOrder( ['name'] )
00179                 self.shortcutsModel.setRecordGroup( self.shortcutsGroup )
00180                 self.shortcutsModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00181                 self.uiShortcuts.setModel( self.shortcutsModel )
00182                 
00183                 if not p.toolbar:
00184                         self.uiList.hide()
00185                 else:
00186                         # Highlight the first element of the list and update the tree
00187                         self.uiList.setCurrentIndex( self.uiList.moveCursor( QAbstractItemView.MoveHome, Qt.NoModifier ) )
00188                         self.updateTree()
00189                 self.restoreViewState()
00190 
00191         def saveIndexState(self, index):
00192                 mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00193                 key = ( index.row(), index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00194                 if not mainKey in self.treeState:
00195                         self.treeState[mainKey] = {}
00196                 self.treeState[mainKey][ key ] = self.uiTree.isExpanded( index )
00197 
00198         def restoreIndexStates(self):
00199                 mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00200                 if not mainKey in self.treeState:
00201                         return
00202                 subtree = self.treeState[ mainKey ]
00203                 for key, value in subtree.iteritems():
00204                         index = self.treeModel.createIndex( key[0], key[1], key[2] )
00205                         self.uiTree.setExpanded( index, value )
00206 
00207         def updateTree(self):
00208                 item = self.uiList.currentIndex()
00209                 if not item.isValid():
00210                         return
00211                 id = item.data( Qt.UserRole ).toInt()[0]
00212                 if not id:
00213                         return
00214                 m = self.group[ id ]
00215                 group = m.value( self.childrenField )
00216                 group.addFields( self.group.fields )
00217                 self.treeModel.setRecordGroup( group )
00218         
00219         def mainMenuClicked( self, currentIndex, previousIndex ):
00220                 if self.toolbar:
00221                         self.treeAllExpandedState[ self.listModel.id( previousIndex ) ] = self.pushExpand.isChecked()
00222                 self.updateTree()
00223                 if self.toolbar:
00224                         self.setAllExpanded( self.treeAllExpandedState.get( self.listModel.id( currentIndex ), False ) )
00225                         self.restoreIndexStates()
00226 
00227         def setAllExpanded(self, value):
00228                 self.pushExpand.setChecked( value )
00229                 if value:
00230                         self.uiTree.expandAll()
00231                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/up.png' ) )
00232                 else:
00233                         self.uiTree.collapseAll()
00234                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/down.png' ) )
00235 
00236         def reload(self):
00237                 QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.WaitCursor )
00238                 self.group.update()
00239                 self.uiList.setCurrentIndex( self.uiList.moveCursor( QAbstractItemView.MoveHome, Qt.NoModifier ) )
00240                 self.treeAllExpandedState = {}
00241                 self.treeState = {}
00242                 self.updateTree()
00243                 # Reload shortcuts and emit the shortcutsChanged
00244                 # signal so 'Window' menu and these shortcuts can be
00245                 # kept in sync.
00246                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00247                 self.emit( SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model )
00248                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00249 
00250         # TODO: Look if for some menu entries this has any sense. Otherwise
00251         # remove both functions. Of course we should connect the actions and
00252         # add them to the handlers dict if they are necessary.
00253         def printCurrent(self):
00254                 self.executeAction(keyword='client_print_multi', report_type='html')
00255 
00256         def printHtmlCurrent(self):
00257                 self.executeAction(keyword='client_print_multi')
00258 
00259         def executeAction(self, keyword='tree_but_action', id=None, report_type='pdf'):
00260                 if id:
00261                         Api.instance.executeKeyword(keyword, {'model':self.model, 'id':id, 'report_type':report_type, 'ids': [id]})
00262                 else:
00263                         QMessageBox.information( self, '', _('No resource selected!'))
00264 
00265         def open(self, idx):
00266                 id = self.treeModel.id( idx )
00267                 if id:
00268                         self.executeAction( 'tree_but_open', id )
00269 
00270         def editCurrentItem(self):
00271                 id = self.treeModel.id( self.uiTree.currentIndex() )
00272                 if id:
00273                         Api.instance.createWindow(None, self.model, id, self.domain)
00274                 else:
00275                         QMessageBox.information(self, '', _('No resource selected!'))
00276 
00277         def removeShortcut(self):
00278                 id = self.currentShortcutId()
00279                 if not id:
00280                         return
00281                 Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'unlink', [id])
00282                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00283                 self.emit(SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model)
00284 
00285         def editShortcuts(self):
00286                 domain = [('user_id', '=', Rpc.session.uid), ('resource', '=', self.model)]
00287                 Api.instance.createWindow(None, 'ir.ui.view_sc', domain=domain, mode='tree,form')
00288 
00289         def addShortcut(self):
00290                 id = self.treeModel.id( self.uiTree.currentIndex() )
00291                 if id == None:
00292                         QMessageBox.information( self, _('No item selected'), _('Please select an element from the tree to add a shortcut to it.') )
00293                         return
00294                 res = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.model, 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)
00295                 for (id,name) in res:
00296                         uid = Rpc.session.uid
00297                         Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'create', {'resource':self.model, 'user_id':uid, 'res_id':id, 'name':name})
00298                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00299                 self.emit( SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model )
00300 
00301         def goToShortcut(self, index):
00302                 id = self.currentShortcutId()
00303                 if not id:
00304                         return
00305                 m = self.shortcutsGroup[ id ]
00306                 # We need to get the value as if we were the server because we
00307                 # don't want the string that would be shown for the many2one field
00308                 # but the id.
00309                 id = self.shortcutsGroup.fieldObjects[ 'res_id' ].get( m )
00310                 if not id:
00311                         return
00312                 self.executeAction('tree_but_open', id)
00313 
00314         def expand(self):
00315                 if self.toolbar:
00316                         # As expandAll() and collapseAll() do not emit 
00317                         # a signal for each item, remove all states stored
00318                         # for this list index.
00319                         mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00320                         if mainKey in self.treeState:
00321                                 del self.treeState[ mainKey ]
00322                 if self.pushExpand.isChecked():
00323                         self.uiTree.expandAll()
00324                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/up.png' ) )
00325                 else:
00326                         self.uiTree.collapseAll()
00327                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/down.png' ) )
00328 
00329         def currentShortcutId(self):
00330                 item = self.uiShortcuts.currentIndex()
00331                 if not item.isValid():
00332                         return None
00333                 id = item.data( Qt.UserRole ).toInt()[0]
00334                 return id
00335 
00336         # There's no reason why a menu can't be closed, is it?
00337         def canClose(self):
00338                 self.storeViewState()
00339                 return True
00340         
00341         def storeViewState(self):
00342                 id = self.view['view_id']
00343                 if not id:
00344                         return
00345                 header = self.uiTree.header()
00346                 ViewSettings.store( id, str( header.saveState().toBase64() ) )
00347                 
00348         def restoreViewState(self):
00349                 id = self.view['view_id']
00350                 if not id:
00351                         return
00352                 settings = ViewSettings.load( id )
00353                 if not settings:
00354                         return
00355                 header = self.uiTree.header()
00356                 header.restoreState( QByteArray.fromBase64( settings ) )
00357                 
00358         def actions(self):
00359                 return []
00360 
00361         def switchViewMenu(self):
00362                 return None
